description: Guidance about meeting the building regulations, given by decisions on disputes made by the Secretary of State for Housing, Communities and Local Government.

details.body:
Introduction

If you want to carry out building work but cannot agree with the building control body (a local authority or approved inspector) about whether the proposed works or a particular aspect of the work complies with the building regulations, you can apply to the Secretary of State for Housing, Communities and Local Government to decide.

The decision made by the secretary of state is called a ‘determination’.

We’ve published a guide to determinations and appeals that contains more details about the determinations process and when you should use it. The law governing the procedure is the Building Act 1984.

If you have more questions about building regulations determinations, email enquiries.br@communities.gov.uk.

How to apply

Complete the form below and post or email it to the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government. The address is on the form.

Building regulations determinations: application form

MS Word Document, 1.03 MB

Determination decisions

The latest decision made by the secretary of state was published on the 24 February 2015.

Determination about a building extension and addition of a new mezzanine floor (Ref SB/007/001/012)

PDF, 147 KB, 4 pages

This file may not be suitable for users of assistive technology.

Request an accessible format.
If you use assistive technology (such as a screen reader) and need a version of this document in a more accessible format, please email alternativeformats@communities.gov.uk. Please tell us what format you need. It will help us if you say what assistive technology you use.

Previous determinations made by the secretary of state are listed below, categorised by the part of the building regulations they refer to:

A1: loading

The downloads below relate to part A1 of the building regulations.

Determination about 2 plywood web beams, forming part of a roof space conversion (ref: 45/1/210)

PDF, 17.3 KB, 4 pages

The downloads below relate to part A2 of the building regulations.

change_history.note: Added a new determination letter under Section B1: means of warning and escape. The letter relates to a decision in respect of a building extension and addition of a new mezzanine floor. Updated Determination application form.
Added a detemination letter relating to material change of use of a dwelling into 2 separate units under new heading: Determinations relating to general building regulations compliance issues.
Added determination about a proposal to provide a side extension to an existing 3 storey town house (ref: SB/007/001/010) under Requirement B1: means of warning and escape.
Added Determination letter ref: SB/007/001/009 under sub heading B1: means of warning and escape
Added Determination letter about a 2 storey side and rear extension, single storey rear extension and loft conversion (ref: SB/007/001/008) under section B1
